articles.title: Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Erected in Rason City
articles.content:
Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Erected in Rason City
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il erected in Rason City were unveiled on Friday.
					 They were erected on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol and other senior party, state and army officials, the chief secretary of the Rason City Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), the chairman of the Rason City People's Committee, officials concerned, officials of the units that contributed to the erection of the statues, builders, working people in the city, youth and students and service personnel.
					
					 Present there on invitation were staff members of the Russian consulate-general in Chongjin and foreigners staying in the city.
					
					 The statues were unveiled by leading officials of the party, state and army.
					
					 A floral basket whose ribbon bore the august name of Marshal Kim Jong Un was placed before the statues.
					
					 Laid before them were a floral basket in the joint name of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet and floral basket in the name of the people in the city.
					
					 Also placed there were floral baskets in the name of party and power organs, working people's organizations, institutions, industrial establishments, farms, universities in the city and units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces.
					
					 Foreigners staying in the city laid a floral basket before them.
					
					 The participants paid tribute to them.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee who doubles as president of the SPA Presidium, addressed the ceremony.
					
					 He said that the city is associated with the revolutionary leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The people in the city turned out as one to dedicate themselves to the erection of the statues at the highest level in a short span of time, with ardent yearning for the great leaders and with firm faith and will to glorify their history for all ages, he noted.
					
					 He called on all officials and working people to hold Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in high esteem forever and get united close around the Party Central Committee headed by Kim Jong Un to march forward dynamically toward final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 The participants were briefed on the statues before looking round them.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Meets Malian Ambassador
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Meets Malian Ambassador
Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong met and had a talk with Malian Ambassador to the DPRK Lansina Boua Kone who paid a courtesy call on him on Friday.

articles.title: Just Struggle of S. Korean Workers Is Sure to Win: Spokesman for C.C., GFTUK
articles.content:
Just Struggle of S. Korean Workers Is Sure to Win: Spokesman for C.C., GFTUK
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Massive actions of people from all walks life in south Korea are being staged in south Korea in protest against the unpopular rule of the fascist authorities.
					 The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU), which is taking the lead in the struggle for social democracy and genuine life of the workers, in a press conference on Feb. 25 formally declared it would wage a campaign to force the regime to step down  through the April general strike and on Mar. 11 trade unions under the KCTU and the Federation of Trade Unions of south Korea held an inaugural ceremony of joint action of the manufacturing field at which they vowed to launch a general strike in case the authorities make "restructuring of labor market".
					
					 Different regional headquarters of the KCTU held roving round-table talks and intensive rallies at which they expressed their will to check and frustrate the puppet conservative regime's moves to retrogressively revise the "labor law".
					
					 Mounting high are massive actions across south Korea such as rallies and demonstrations by more than 80 000 people of all social standings including government employees in Seoul on March 28 in protest against the regime's retrogressive revision of pension for government employees.
					
					 A spokesman for the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) in a statement issued on Friday said this is an eruption of the pent-up grievance and resentment at the puppet conservative group which is ruthlessly trampling down the democratic right and vital rights of the south Koreans.
					
					 The C.C., GFTUK extends full support and firm solidarity to the massive actions of people from all walks of life in south Korea including workers who have resolutely risen up to oppose the puppet group's sycophancy and acts of treachery and unpopular rule and defend their independent demand and vital rights, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Since the emergence of the present regime, the U.S. colonial subjugation of south Korea has deepened, the living conditions of the people have worsened and south Korea has turned into the worst hell and tundra of human rights.
					
					 Thrown into the mire of destitution, workers are committing suicides and some of them have been on sit-in strike for several months on a high chimney in winter. Streets are flooded with huge crowds of jobless people. 
					
					 However, the puppet group is brutally suppressing their actions by labeling them "illegal ones," lending a deaf ear to their strong demands.
					
					 The south Korean workers should turn out as one in the all-people resistance at these crossroads of life and death and thus mete out a stern judgment to the puppet conservative regime.  
					
					 The entire working class in the northern half of Korea will voice positive support to the just actions of the workers and people from all walks of life in south Korea for democracy and the right to existence in the future, too, and express firm conviction that their just struggle is sure to triumph.

articles.title: 20th Food Festival Marks Day of Sun
articles.content:
20th Food Festival Marks Day of Sun
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The 20th Food Festival took place at Pyongyang Noodle House from April 1 to 3 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun (the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung).
					 The festival brought together more than 900 service workers of 50 units selected from ministries, national institutions and provinces. It was divided into such panels as exhibition of sci-tech successes gained in cooking, exhibitions of holiday food and designated food, contest and demonstration of skills of cooks and waitresses.
					
					 Presented to the festival were peculiar dishes, drinks and sci-tech successes made by them.
					
					 New dishes, processed food, cooking utensils, cookery books, video clips on cooking presented by public catering establishments were on show at the exhibition of sci-tech successes gained in cooking to draw attention of visitors.
					
					 Designated food exhibition and holiday food exhibition showing various dishes, staple food and drinks added to the festive atmosphere.
					
					 There were also skill demonstrations of cooks and waitresses of various units including Pyongyang Catfish Soup House.
					
					 A closing ceremony was held on March 3.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Marks 67th Anniversary of April 3 Popular Uprising on Jeju Island
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Marks 67th Anniversary of April 3 Popular Uprising on Jeju Island
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday devotes an article to the 67th anniversary of the April 3 popular uprising on Jeju Island. 
					 The U.S. imperialists illegally occupied south Korea and their policy to turn south Korea into their colony and the moves to split the Korean nation got ever more undisguised in 1948, the article notes, and goes on: 
					
					 They cooked up a separate "government" in south Korea to justify their colonial rule and perpetuate the national division. 
					
					 Residents on Jeju Island held a meeting to protest against the election for separate "government". Much upset by this, the U.S. imperialists and their lackeys suppressed the peaceful meeting by force of arms. The angry participants of the meeting launched an anti-U.S. struggle on Yon Peak of Mt. Halla at two on April 3. 
					
					 The April 3 popular uprising on Jeju Island was a mass resistance which recorded a brilliant page in the history of the south Korean people's struggle. It fully demonstrated the ardent desire and strong will not to live as colonial slaves of foreign forces.
					
					 Nearly seven decades have passed since the popular uprising, but the outside forces' colonial rule over south Korea is going on and Korea remains partitioned. 
					
					 This is attributable to the U.S. domination over south Korea and its policy for aggression and the fascist dictatorship of the pro-U.S. conservative forces and their moves to escalate confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north. 
					
					 South Korean people will never be free from misfortune and pain and the danger of war will always prevail on the Korean peninsula as long as south Korea is under the U.S. military occupation and domination and the sycophants and traitors are allowed to stay to kowtow to the aggressors.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Japan's Moves to Cover up Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Japan's Moves to Cover up Sexual Slavery
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Some civic organizations of the U.S. launched a signature campaign demanding the erection of statues of sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army in San Francisco and other areas of California.
					 This is the first time that they have conducted the signature campaign in denunciation of the sexual slavery for the Japanese imperialists. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary says Japan's desperate bid to deny and evade the responsibility for the sexual slavery will only harden the will of the international community never to tolerate it.
					
					 Much upset by the construction of monuments to the memory of sexual slaves and statues one after another in the U.S., the Japanese ultra-right reactionary forces lodged protests with the U.S. administration and relevant city authorities, holding negotiations and staging signature campaign, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Japan's moves are the biggest insult to a number of Korean women who had suffered mental and physical pain with their chastity violated under the boots of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 Clear is the conclusion in the light of the rhetoric and bad behavior of the Japanese ruling quarters. That is to cover up the crime-woven past history and the hideous crimes against humanity and evade the redemption of the past.
					
					 Japan's distortion of history is aimed to repeat the history of aggression.
					
					 Its desperate efforts to distort the past history interwoven with crimes and evade the responsibility for it are useless. The way for Japan to get rid of international censure and isolation is to redeem its past crimes at an early date.

articles.title: Kim Ki Jong Indicted by Prosecution
articles.content:
Kim Ki Jong Indicted by Prosecution
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The puppet Seoul Central District Prosecutor's Office of south Korea on Wednesday detained and indicted Kim Ki Jong, representative of the Uri Madang, a civic organization calling for peace against war. 
					 Kim made knife attack on the U.S. Ambassador to south Korea on Mar. 5.
					
					 The attack case was a reflection of the mindset of the public in south Korea protesting against the U.S. which has increased the danger of a war on the Korean peninsula by kicking up joint war drills.
					
					 However, the puppet group has been busy clamping down upon him after branding his righteous deed as terrorism.
					
					 The puppet prosecution authorities formed an "ad hoc investigation group" and hurled all prosecutors under the Public Security Department No. 1 of the Seoul Central District Prosecutor's Office into making investigation into the case. At last, they decided to prolong the detention of Kim and referred the case to the court on unreasonable charges of "motives of attempt at murder and other suspicions, their background and additional investigation into forces behind the attack."

articles.title: Corruption and Irregularities Get Endemic in S. Korean Society
articles.content:
Corruption and Irregularities Get Endemic in S. Korean Society
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- More scandals committed by abuse of power have been disclosed in south Korea, sparking off a big furor.
					 Former chief secretary for Educational and Cultural Affairs of Chongwadae Pak Pom Hun was revealed to have embezzled funds of a local autonomous body.
					
					 In 2008 he donated funds to an art association and enabled Yangphyong County to construct an institute with an investment of 950 million won.
					
					 But it was discovered that most of the plottage and premise of the institute were recently transferred to the foundation whose managing director is Pak. He is now under investigation by prosecution on charges of embezzling hundreds of millions of won of public funds.

articles.title: Deployment of THAAD Opposed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Deployment of THAAD Opposed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Organizations in Pusan and South Kyongsang Province of south Korea condemned the ruling party for pushing ahead with the deployment of THAAD in south Korea.
					 The Pusan Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration held a press conference outside the building of the Pusan branch of the ruling "Saenuri Party" on Mar. 31.
					
					 Recalling that the "Saenuri party" is going to hold a plenary meeting of lawmakers from the party on the deployment of THAAD, the speakers at the conference said such a debate needs to be canceled at once.
					
					 Deployment of THAAD will establish a new Cold War structure in Northeast Asia and, therefore, threaten peace on the Korean peninsula and waste the money collected from south Koreans as taxes, they deplored, adding:
					
					 Deployment of such offensive hardware disturbing peace on the peninsula and improvement of the south-north relations should not be forced on south Korea.
					
					 That day the South Kyongsang Provincial Progressive Federation launched a demo outside the building of the provincial branch of the "Saenuri Party".
					
					 The federation visited lawmakers to hand a protest letter to them.
					
					 The letter urged the ruling party to immediately stop the moves for THAAD deployment.
					
					 Earlier the Pusan People for Achieving Peace and Reunification paid protest calls at lawmakers from the ruling party in various places including Changwon and Kimhae of South Kyongsang Province on March 26 and 27 and conveyed written opinions calling for stop to the deployment of THAAD to them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Polish Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Polish Website
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" was posted on the Polish website "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea" on March 30.
					 The work, published on July 26, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies the essence of leader Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his whole life characterized by his warm love for the country and people.
					
					 It also indicates the important issues arising in embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Letter Posted by British Body on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Letter Posted by British Body on Its Website
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The full text of "Let Us Usher In a New Heyday of Building a Sports Power in the Revolutionary Spirit of Paektu", a letter sent by Marshal Kim Jong Un to those attending the 7th National Conference of Sportspeople, was posted by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on its website on Mar. 28.
					 The work, published on Mar. 25, Juche 104 (2015), deals with the fact that the Workers' Party of Korea is channeling great efforts into the sports field in order to develop the nation's sports true to President Kim Il Sung's and leader Kim Jong Il's Juche-based idea and intention on developing sports.
					
					 It also clarifies the tasks and ways of successfully realizing the party's plan on building a sports power.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by Foreign Bodies
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by Foreign Bodies
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Foreign bodies posted articles on their websites between Mar. 24 and 27 on the occasion of President Kim Il Sung's birth anniversary.
					 The Peru-Korea Institute of Culture and Friendship posted on its website articles titled "Kim Il Sung, shining august name", "For Global Independence" and "Model internationalist" illustrated with a portrait of the smiling President and photos documenting his revolutionary activities.
					
					 The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany in an article titled "The eternal sun of Juche" said that the world progressives praised the President, father of socialist Korea, as the eternal sun of Juche, adding:
					
					 He fathered the Juche idea in the course of paving a new way for the Korean revolution.
					
					 The founding of the Juche idea opened up the new era of history, the era of independence, when the popular masses carve out independently and creatively the era and the revolution as the masters of the world and their own destinies.
					
					 The President is alive as the sun in the hearts of all people as he ushered in the era of independence and devoted all his life to the victorious advance of the human cause of independence.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in an article titled "Kim Il Sung, holding aloft the banner of independence" praised the feats of the President who made a great contribution to the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence.

articles.title: Day of Sun Observed in Finland, Nigeria
articles.content:
Day of Sun Observed in Finland, Nigeria
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Finland and a film show in Nigeria on March 26 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 On display on the front wall of the venue of the meeting were portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Displayed there were photos dealing with the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed were their works, and books and photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 The participants in the film show watched a Korean film showing the Songun leadership exploits performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chairman of the Finland-Korea Society in a speech said that the Day of the Sun is the most significant holiday of not only the Korean people but also other progressive peoples.
					
					 He noted that Kim Il Sung was the father of socialist Korea who rescued the Korean people from the wretched fate of colonial slaves and put them forward as genuine masters of the country.
					
					 Kim Il Sung was the greatest man as he lightened the way ahead of not only the Korean revolution but the cause of global independence by founding the immortal Juche idea, the chairman said.
					
					 The chairman of the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said that Kim Jong Un gives ceaseless field guidance to defend the sovereignty of the country, build an economic power and provide happier life to the people.
					
					 We will dynamically conduct the solidarity movement supporting the Korean people's just cause this significant year marking the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation, he added.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting held in Finland.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreign Figures
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries on March 27 and 28 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included meetings, photo and book exhibitions and film shows in Bangladesh, Myanmar and Romania.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos dealing with the revolutionary career of the President and his exploits.
					
					 Also on display there were photos and books introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Films shown included Korean film "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation".
					
					 Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, in his report said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung opened up a new era of Juche Korea with his profound ideologies and theories and great revolutionary practice after embarking on the road of the revolution in his early years and performed immortal exploits in the history of struggle for human emancipation.
					
					 He turned the DPRK into a socialist power with firm political, military and economic foothold.
					
					 He poured his heart and soul into realizing the cause of global independence and sincerely supported other countries and nations in their anti-imperialist struggle and cause of building new society all his life.
					
					 The director of an institute of Myanmar in a speech noted that the President devoted his all to the prosperity of the country, happiness of the people and peace and security of the world.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The great exploits of the President will be kept forever in the hearts of not only the Korean people but also progressive mankind.
					
					 The desire of the President is being successfully realized by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The DPRK is further demonstrating its might under his leadership.
					
					 Daniel Dediu, chairman of the Romanian Workers' Association, highly praised the President for defeating the U.S. and Japanese imperialists and building the DPRK as a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Romania
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Romania
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- A Romanian preparatory committee for marking the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed on Mar. 24.
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Party for Socialist Choice of Romania, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The chairman said that the committee was formed with progressive personages in Romania on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the greatest holiday of the Korean people, and added that the committee fixed the celebration period from Mar. 25 to April 15 and would arrange colorful events such as a seminar, meeting, lecture and film show.

articles.title: Portavoz del CC de FGSC expresa apoyo a la justa lucha de obreros surcoreanos
articles.content:
Portavoz del CC de FGSC expresa apoyo a la justa lucha de obreros surcoreanos
Pyongyang, 3 de abril (ACNC) -- Ahora toma auge la lucha masiva de los habitantes surcoreanos de distintos sectores contra la gobernacion antipopular de las autoridades fascistas.
					La Confederacion de Sindicatos Surcoreanos (CSS), abanderada de la lucha por la democratizacion de la sociedad y la vida verdadera de los obreros, declaro oficialmente en la rueda de prensa concedida el 25 de febrero que desarrollara el movimiento por la retirada del "poder" a traves de la huelga general de abril.
					
					El 11 de marzo, los sindicatos dependientes de la CSS y la "Federacion de Sindicatos Surcoreanos" realizaron la ceremonia de constitucion de la direccion de lucha conjunta de la rama manufacturera en que juraron entrar en la huelga general si las autoridades aprueban por la fuerza la "reforma estructural del mercado laboral".
					
					Varias direcciones regionales de la CSS sostuvieron la mesa redonda itineraria y el mitin expresando la voluntad de llevar al fracaso la enmienda de la "ley de trabajo" por parte del poder conservador.
					
					El 28 de marzo, mas de 80 mil personas de distintos sectores incluyendo los funcionarios publicos realizaron en Seul un mitin y manifestacion contra la modificacion de pension de funcionarios publicos.
					
					Al respecto, el portavoz del Comite Central de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea publico el dia 3 una declaracion calificando esa lucha masiva de explosion del rencor acumulado hacia la banda conservadora titere que violo despiadadamente el derecho democratico y el de vida de los habitantes surcoreanos.
					
					El CC de la FGSC envia su apoyo absoluto y firme solidaridad a la lucha masiva de los obreros y otros habitantes de distintos estratos del Sur de Corea, levantados contra el acto vendepatria y servil a grandes potencias y la gobernacion antipopular de las autoridades titeres y por defender las demandas independientes y el derecho de vida, apunta el documento y prosigue:
					
					Despues de la aparicion del actual "poder", el Sur de Corea se hizo colonia mas subyugada a EE.UU., la situacion del pueblo se torno mas dificil y el territorio surcoreano se convirtio en el infierno y tierra privada de derechos humanos.
					
					Algunos obreros sin recursos de subsistencia se suicidan maldiciendo a las autoridades y los otros libran una huelga por varios meses de invierno en una chimenea alta mientras se desbordan a las calles incontables personas desempleadas.
					
					Lejos de escuchar las demandas de ellos, las autoridades titeres surcoreanas les reprimen salvajemente calificando de "ilegal" su lucha.
					
					En este momento de vida o muerte, los obreros surcoreanos deben levantarse unanimemente en la resistencia de todo el pueblo para sentenciar duro al poder conservador. 
					
					Convencidos de que triunfara sin falta la justa lucha de los obreros y otros habitantes surcoreanos por conquistar la democracia y el derecho de vida, todos los obreros de la RPDC seguiran apoyandola totalmente.
